sn47.36:4.1: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
sn47.36:4.3: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.36:4.4: They meditate by observing an aspect of feelings …
sn47.36:4.6: principles, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.36:4.7: These are the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
sn47.36:4.8: Because of developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation, one of two results can be expected:
sn47.36:4.9: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.”
